III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Resident restraint
Title
Rule Code & COF Rule 400.10177
Section Rule 177 (4) Restraint equipment and physical restraint
Description techniques shall not be used for punishment.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 6/10/24, while staff member was restraining a youth for
discipline, the youth incurred several injuries. Youth is afraid for
their ongoing safety. There is video of the incident.
Investigation This complaint was assigned on 06/11/2024 and investigated in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist.
Interviews:
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on 06/13/2024 and
reported no additional information.
Chief Administrator (CA) was interviewed at the facility on
06/14/2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. CA reported
Youth A was restrained on 06/10/2024 due to assaulting a staff
member. He said on 06/11/2024 during a visit with the therapist
and Youth A’s mother, Youth A reported she sustained an injury
as a result of being restrained on 06/10/2024. CA said the nurse
was contacted to exam Youth A during her visit. CA reported the
restraint occurred in Youth A’s room, there is no video footage of
the restraint, the video footage only shows when Youth A was
being escorted to her bedroom.
Youth A was interviewed at the facility on 06/14/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Youth A reported on
06/10/2024 she was upset, because staff accused her of having a
vape pen and searched her room. She said after they searched
her room, she walked past Staff 1 and stuck her tongue out at
him. Staff 1 told her to go and sit in the hallway. Staff 1 and
Supervisor later talked to her about her behavior and that’s why
she had to sit in the hallway. Youth A admitted she was arguing
with Staff 1 and Supervisor and that’s when they escorted her to
her room for a Behavior Management Timeout (BMT). Youth A
admitted when she went into her room, she slammed the door in
Staff 1’s face, and that’s when Staff 1 attacked her in her room.
2

She said Staff 1 pushed her to the floor and started pounding her
head on the floor. She said Supervisor was just standing and
watching Staff 1 attacking her. Youth A cannot recall everything
that happened because she had a blackout and does not recall
being restrained. She does not think that Supervisor did anything
to her. Youth A admitted to telling Staff 1 she was going to have
her father kill staff because they lied about her having a vape pen
and giving her a BMT, which can impact her court case. Youth A
said she had several bumps on her head and injured her wrist
while being restrained by Staff 1. Youth A was examined by the
nurse the following day and was told her wrist was sprained.
Youth A denied any prior incidents with Staff 1 or any other staff
member.
Supervisor was interviewed at the facility on 06/14/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Supervisor has worked at
the facility for 3 months and completed all training including
Handle with Care (HWC). He reported on 06/10/2024 Youth A was
agitated because her room was searched. Staff 1 had Youth A
take a time out in the hallway, he and Staff 1 were talking to Youth
A about her behavior and that’s when Youth A became more
escalated and argumentative. Youth A yelled at Staff 1, telling him
she was going to have her father shoot Staff 1 in the face. He and
Staff 1 escorted Youth A to her room for a Behavior Management
Timeout, which means a time out in her room to calm down. When
they got to her room Staff 1 opened the door and asked Youth A
to go in her room. Youth A walked into her room, Staff 1 was
about to close the door, and Youth A attacked Staff 1 by punching
him in the face. Supervisor went in the room, and he and Staff 1
restrained Youth A. He said Youth A was fighting the restraint and
therefore they ended up on the floor. Youth A was restrained on
her back on the floor, Staff 1 held her right arm and Supervisor
held her left arm (two person floor restraint) until she calmed
down. Supervisor denied Staff 1 hit or grabbed Youth A’s head.
He said Youth A repeatedly told them that she was going to have
her father kill them. He spoke with Youth A afterwards and Youth
A did not report having any injures.
Staff 1 was interviewed at the facility on 06/14/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 1 is a youth specialist
and has worked at the facility for 9 months. Staff 1 reported he
has no prior incidents with Youth A and usually Youth A is very
pleasant. On 06/10/2024 Youth A was upset that her room was
searched by Staff 2 that morning. He said Youth A was making
faces at him and being disrespectful, so he asked her to take a
3

time out in the hallway. A few minutes later he and Supervisor
went to talk to Youth A, and that’s when Youth A started cussing
and threating them. Youth A said she was going to have her father
shoot them in the head. He and Supervisor attempted to verbally
de-escalate Youth A, but she got more aggressive; cussing and
threating them, so they told her she had to go to her room for a
BMT. He and supervisor walked Youth A to her bedroom. He
opened the door and when Youth A stepped in her room, she tried
to shut the door on his arm and punched him in the face.
Supervisor came into the room, and they restrained Youth A. He
said Youth A went to the floor and they restrained Youth A with
her back on the floor. He denied hitting or grabbing Youth A ‘s
head. He was on her left side and Supervisor was on her right
side. Once Youth A calmed down, they released the restraint. He
denied Youth A was injured or complained about having any
injuries.
Staff 2 was interviewed at the facility on 06/14/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 2 is a direct care
worker and has been working at the facility for one year. Staff 2
was working on 06/10/2024. She said it was reported that Youth A
had a vape pen, so Youth A’s room was searched but nothing was
found. She said Youth A was agitated about her room being
search and so Staff 1 told Youth A to take a time out in the
hallway. Staff 2 did not witness the incident between Staff 1 and
Youth A, but she did hear Youth A cussing and threatening Staff 1
and Supervisor when Youth A was in the hallway.
Staff 3 was interviewed at the facility on 06/14/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 3 reported she was
supervising Youth A on 06/08/2024 while in the recreation room,
Youth A had run into the wall while bowling and hurt her wrist. She
gave Youth A an ice pack for her wrist and offered her Tylenol, but
Youth A refused the Tylenol. She said Youth A didn’t complain or
indicate that her wrist was sprained.
Nurse was interviewed at the facility on 06/14/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Nurse reported she was
informed on 06/10/2024 by Supervisor that Youth A was
restrained and was not complaining of any injuries or pain. On
06/11/2024 Director asked her to examine Youth A, because
Youth A reported she had sustained injuries from being restrained
on 06/10/2024. She examined Youth A on 06/11/2024, Youth A
did have a couple of scratches on her neck and her left ear was
purple. Youth A did not have any injuries to her wrists, or head.
She denied Youth A had a sprained wrist. Nurse examined Youth
4

A again on 06/12/2024 and Youth A’s ear was normal, which
surprised her because if Youth A’s ear was bruised it would not
have healed in 24 hours. Nurse could not confirm what would
have caused Youth A’s ear to become purple for approximately 24
hours.
Director was interviewed at the facility on 06/14/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Director reported Supervisor
and Staff 1 checked with Youth A after being restrained and she
denied having any injuries. Youth A was examined by the nurse
the following day after Youth A reported to her therapist that she
was injured. Director reported Youth A had hurt her wrist two days
prior of being restrained during a bowing activity in the recreation
room on 06/08/2024. Director provided the shift log form dated
06/08/2024 that showed Youth A hurt her wrist in the recreation
room while bowling.
Video Review:
• On 06/14/2024 reviewed video footage for date 06/10/2024
at approximately 3:30pm. The video is of the hallway
outside of Youth A’s bedroom. Staff 1, Supervisor, and
Youth A are standing outside of the bedroom. Staff 1
opened the bedroom door, the door swung into the room
and Staff 1 walked into the room. Youth A followed without
staff assistance. Supervisor rushed into the room. There is
no view of the doorway or into the bedroom.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident reported dated 06/10/2024 completed by
Supervisor is consistent with Supervisor’s interview.
• Facility restraints, escorts, and de-escalation policy:
Physical restraints must be preformed in a manner that is
safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity of the
youth’s behavior, chronological and developmental age,
size, gender, physical condition, and consistent with
behavior management plan. A physical restraint must only
be applied for the minimum time necessary to restore
safety to the situation.
• Handle with Care Training Manual: The use of prompt,
skillful and appropriate interventions when physical restraint
is necessary, in order to minimize injuries to children and
staff. Reinforce that we are ethically and legally obligated to
use the least amount of force necessary to defend yourself
against a physical assault. Personal defense techniques:
5

Same side wrist grab and transition. Two on one wrist grab
and transition. Two person supine restraint (two person
floor restraint).
• Personnel file for Staff 1 and Supervisor- no disciplinary
action.
Analysis Based on interviews conducted, video footage, and
documentations reviewed, there is insufficient evidence to support
the allegations that Youth A was hurt when she was restrained.
Youth A reported that Staff 1 was pounding her head on the floor,
but Staff 1 and Supervisor denied that Staff 1 pounded Youth A’s
head on the floor.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
